contentrichtext.text: {{automatic taxobox | name = Ancylopods | fossil_range = {{fossil range|Eocene|Early Pleistocene}} | subdivision_ranks = [[Family (biology)|Superfamilies]]<ref>{{Cite book | last = Jacobs | first = Louis L. | coauthors = Scott, Kathleen Marie | title = Evolution of Tertiary Mammals of North America: Terrestrial carnivores, ungulates, and ungulatelike mammals | publisher = Cambridge University Press | year = 1998 | pages = | url = | doi = | isbn =978-0-521-35519-3}}</ref> | subdivision = *[[Chalicotherioidea]] *[[Isectolophidae]] *[[Lophiodontidae]] }} '''Ancylopoda''' is a group of browsing, [[herbivorous]], [[mammal]]s in the [[Perissodactyla]] that show long, curved and cleft [[claw]]s.<ref>{{cite journal | last = Coombs | first = Margery C. | coauthors = Rothschild, Bruce M. | title = Phalangeal Fusion in Schizotheriine Chalicotheres (Mammalia, Perissodactyla) | journal = Journal of Paleontology | volume = 73 | issue = 4 | pages = 682â€“690 | publisher = Paleontological Society | date = Jul 1999 | jstor = 1306767 | doi = | accessdate = 2009-12-31}}</ref> [[Morphology (biology)|Morphological]] evidence indicates the Ancylopoda diverged from the [[tapir]]s, [[rhinoceros]]es and [[horse]]s ([[Euperissodactyla]]) after the Brontotheria, however earlier authorities such as [[Osborn]]{{disambiguation needed|date=November 2012}} sometimes considered the Ancylopoda to be outside Perissodactyla or, as was popular more recently, to be related to [[Brontotheria]]. == References == <references/> [[Category:Chalicotheres]] [[Category:Articles lacking sources from June 2009]] [[Category:All articles lacking sources]] {{paleo-oddtoedungulate-stub}}
